goal.ch: This course aims to provide students with an understanding of econometric theory and the ability to apply econometric and statistical methods by using econometric softwares. This course will provide a foundation for applied research in economics and finance. Students will learn to apply appropriate econometric methods to adopt empirical research. There will be homework assignments. Some of the assignments will involve estimating econometric models using real data; students can choose their preferred software to practice. EViews and R are the official course software and useful resources for learning EViews and R will be provided on the EE-CLASS platform.
goal.en: This course aims to provide students with an understanding of econometric theory and the ability to apply econometric and statistical methods by using econometric softwares. This course will provide a foundation for applied research in economics and finance. Students will learn to apply appropriate econometric methods to adopt empirical research. There will be homework assignments. Some of the assignments will involve estimating econometric models using real data; students can choose their preferred software to practice. EViews and R are the official course software and useful resources for learning EViews and R will be provided on the EE-CLASS platform.

outline.ch: Several major advances in time series, forecasting and software engineering have occurred in the past few years. These advances provide a major breakthrough in the modeling of time series using easy-to-use object-oriented Windows based software (such as EViews). Students can also learn to use R which is a free software environment for statistical computing and graphics. The course overviews econometric modeling and uses real-life business and economic data to show how to interpret and report the results.
outline.en: Several major advances in time series, forecasting and software engineering have occurred in the past few years. These advances provide a major breakthrough in the modeling of time series using easy-to-use object-oriented Windows based software (such as EViews). Students can also learn to use R which is a free software environment for statistical computing and graphics. The course overviews econometric modeling and uses real-life business and economic data to show how to interpret and report the results.

textbook.ch:
The textbook is Greene, W. H., 2017, Econometric Analysis, 8th ed., Pearson,
* For the advanced level of econometric theory, the following books are good references.
(1) Hansen, B. E., 2022, Econometrics, Bruce E. Hansen, University of Wisconsin. [ http://www.ssc.wisc.edu/~bhansen/econometrics/] 
(2) Hayashi, F. 2000, Econometrics, Princeton University Press. 
[http://fhayashi.fc2web.com/hayashi_econometrics.htm]
(3) Hamilton, J. D., 1994, Time Series Analysis, Princeton University Press. 
(4) Wooldridge, J.M., latest edition, 2000, Econometric Analysis of Cross Section and Panel Data, 2nd ed., MIT Press. 
(5) Diebold, F.X. (2020), Econometric Data Analysis, Department of Economics, University of Pennsylvania, http://www.ssc.upenn.edu/~fdiebold/Textbooks.html
* For the basic introduction to econometrics, students can refer to Stock, J.H. and Watson, M.W., 2019, Introduction to Econometrics (fourth edition), Addison-Wesley. Wooldridge, J. M., 2019, Introductory Econometrics: A Modern Approach, 7th ed., Cengage Learning, is also a useful reference for the introductory level of econometrics. Although they will not be used in class but they provide a complementary treatment that some students might find helpful. The following book in Chinese is also helpful: 周賓凰 (2022)，計量經濟學: 理論、觀念與應用，智勝公司。

For references on R, students can browse at https://www.r-project.org/.
Companion of R for Wooldridge (2013) https://www.r-econometrics.com/reproduction/wooldridge/wooldridgeintro/
Description to Wooldridge data set is available on http://fmwww.bc.edu/ec-p/data/wooldridge/datasets.list.html
Text Resources and Online Appendices for Greene (2017)
https://pages.stern.nyu.edu/~wgreene/Text/econometricanalysis.htm

gradMethod.ch: Class Participation: 10％; Problem Sets: 30％; Midterm Exam: 30％; Final Exam: 30％.
gradMethod.en: Class Participation: 10％; Problem Sets: 30％; Midterm Exam: 30％; Final Exam: 30％.

flexDiscription.ch: Some reading assignments will be given during the last two weeks for help students understand the application of econometric methods.
flexDiscription.en: Some reading assignments will be given during the last two weeks for help students understand the application of econometric methods.

ch.competencies: 獨立思考和解決問題能力

ch: 系所:限財務金融學系博士班。年級:限一年級。
